revised_title: Observation of the Eclipse of the Moon in 1740 at St. Catharine, Brazil
tldr: Captain Edward Legge of the HMS Severn observed an eclipse of the Moon on December 21, 1740, at the Island of St. Catharine on the coast of Brazil. The observation was later confirmed by calculations and compared to Senex's maps, revealing potential inaccuracies in the geographical representation of the area.
